toc_entry.title: CAN YOU TAKE A HINT?
toc_entry.description: Heloise, America’s best-known homemaker, has a dirty little secret: she hates to clean house. If you hate it too, she’s convinced that you need her more than ever.

toc_entry.title: THE WAR ZONE
toc_entry.description: When crack comes to a neighborhood, it infiltrates, it corrupts, and it destroys—and there is nothing the cops can do about it.

toc_entry.title: HONORABLE TOYS
toc_entry.description: Godzilla lives! Just ask any Texas collector of Japanese action figures.

toc_entry.title: HOW HOUSTON BEAT THE BUST (SORT OF)
REAL ESTATE
toc_entry.description: The resurrection of a former “see-through” office building. How a land developer diversified — into Jaguars. And secrets of the “vultures” who buy up, fix up, and fill up troubled Houston apartments.

toc_entry.title: ENERGY
toc_entry.description: Engineer Saba Haregot’s love affair with Houston (it’s not just all those job offers). How natural gas is helping to reinflate the economy. And a shuttered plant that tempers oil pipe opens up.

toc_entry.title: BRANCHING OUT
toc_entry.description: An entrepreneur captures customers in public rest rooms. A high-tech plant moves from oil to medicine. Space and biomedical manufacturing are finally off the drawing boards. And a former union boss becomes a bingo mogul.

toc_entry.title: COMPADRES DE LA REVOLUCION
toc_entry.description: Though the leaders of Mexico’s revolution all lived short and violent lives, a handful of those who rode with them have survived to a ripe old age in Texas.

toc_entry.title: THIS WATER IS MY WATER
toc_entry.description: Cool, clear, and pure, it’s the bounty of the Edwards Aquifer, and if something isn’t done to limit pumping by Hill Country farmers and a thirsty San Antonio, it may also be dry.

toc_entry.title: THE DRILL-STEM FENCE
toc_entry.subtitle: TEXAS PRIMER
toc_entry.description: A lot stronger and more hospitable than barbed wire, this is one of those good fences that make good neighbors.

toc_entry.title: POWER PLAY
toc_entry.subtitle: POLITICS
toc_entry.description: Houston Lighting and Power’s purchase of a Canadian cable TV company may come as a shock to HL&P ratepayers.

toc_entry.title: MOJO MADNESS
toc_entry.subtitle: SPORTS
toc_entry.description: The Permian Panthers provide the best entertainment between Dallas and El Paso, and nobody enjoys the show more than Jerry Swindall.

toc_entry.title: HASTY COPY
toc_entry.subtitle: BOOKS
toc_entry.description: Dan Jenkins’ latest takes a tough-cookie journalist out of a thirties movie and puts her into a chase through Depression-era Fort Worth; Sarah Glasscock populates her fictional Alpine with a cast of real characters.

toc_entry.title: AROUND THE STATE
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Hieromania, the burning curiosity of glyphies; Post time in the race for Houston’s new gossip columnist; an unlikely car and an unlikelier trailer; the parking garage from hell.

toc_entry.title: STATE SECRETS
toc_entry.description: The worst school districts in Texas—and how they got that way; where have all the bankers gone?; why Dukakis fell behind in Texas.
